lead_paragraph: A day after the mayor declared the matter closed, his proposal to limit the hansoms to Central Park drew more criticism, with pedicab drivers chanting “one-term mayor” outside City Hall.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and J. DAVID GOODMAN

headline.print_headline: De Blasio’s Horse Plan Gains More Opponents
headline.main: Mayor de Blasio’s Plan on Horse-Drawn Carriages Keeps Gaining Critics

snippet: A day after the mayor declared the matter closed, his proposal to limit the hansoms to Central Park drew more criticism, with pedicab drivers chanting “one-term mayor” outside City Hall.
abstract: Opponents of New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's plan to reduce horse-carriage trade in Manhattan and relocate animals into Central Park gather at number of rallies around city to voice their opposition; de Blasio administration is hoping to secure quick approval from City Council on plan, which faces diverse group of opponents.
